programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Directed by Abbas Mustan, Race features Saif Ali Khan and Akshaye Khanna as rival brothers in the horse racing business. With twists and turns at every corner, the film delves into themes of greed and betrayal, keeping audiences guessing until the end.

programme.title: Faltu
programme.desc: F.A.L.T.U (short for Fakirchand and Lakirchand Trust University) is a youth-centric comedy-drama that follows a group of friends who, after being rejected by traditional colleges, decide to invent their own fake institution to satisfy their parents. Unexpectedly, the college becomes popular among similarly “non-performing” students seeking a second chance. Starring Jackky Bhagnani, Riteish Deshmukh, and Arshad Warsi, the film is a commentary on India’s rigid education system and encourages thinking outside the box.

programme.title: Simmba
programme.desc: Simmba follows the story of Sangram "Simmba" Bhalerao, a corrupt and flamboyant police officer who enjoys the perks of his position until a personal tragedy forces him to rethink his choices. Transforming into a man of justice, Simmba takes on a powerful criminal nexus. With high-octane action, emotional drama, and punchy dialogues, this Rohit Shetty directorial stars Ranveer Singh and Sara Ali Khan in a thrilling narrative of redemption.

programme.desc: F.A.L.T.U (short for Fakirchand and Lakirchand Trust University) is a youth-centric comedy-drama that follows a group of friends who, after being rejected by traditional colleges, decide to invent their own fake institution to satisfy their parents. Unexpectedly, the college becomes popular among similarly “non-performing” students seeking a second chance. Starring Jackky Bhagnani, Riteish Deshmukh, and Arshad Warsi, the film is a commentary on India’s rigid education system and encourages thinking outside the box.

programme.title: Iqbal
programme.desc: Iqbal is an inspiring sports drama about a young boy (played by Shreyas Talpade) who is deaf and mute but dreams of playing cricket for the Indian national team. With the help of a reclusive former cricketer (Naseeruddin Shah), he trains rigorously, battling societal prejudices, family pressure, and systemic challenges. Directed by Nagesh Kukunoor, the film is a heartfelt celebration of determination, dreams, and triumph against adversity. It’s widely appreciated for its emotional depth and uplifting narrative.

programme.title: Holiday - A Soldier is Never Off Duty
programme.desc: Directed by A. R. Murugadoss, this action thriller stars Akshay Kumar as Captain Virat Bakshi, who stumbles upon a sleeper cell network during his holiday. Balancing his personal life and duty, he works to prevent a major terrorist attack. The film is a Hindi remake of the Tamil movie Thuppakki.
